summary: This is an internal email recap of a financial transfer for Ghislaine Maxwell and related entities, detailing the movement of banking and investment assets from JPMorgan to UBS. It provides a snapshot of Maxwell's financial holdings and the entities she controlled as of late 2013/early 2014.

connections.description: Garcia sent a detailed financial transfer recap to Stackman regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's accounts.
Garcia copied Casriel on the email containing the financial recap for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Stackman is the recipient of financial information detailing the transfer of Maxwell's assets.
Maxwell is associated with the 'Max Foundation,' which held assets being transferred.
Maxwell is associated with the LLC named after a New York City address, which held assets being transferred.

events.title: Asset Valuation Snapshot
events.description: Market values of Ghislaine Maxwell's and related entities' banking and investment assets are recorded as of this date.

events.title: Financial Transfer Recap Communication
events.description: An email is sent recapping the transfer of Ghislaine Maxwell's financial assets from JPMorgan accounts to UBS.

keyFacts: As of December 31, 2013, Ghislaine Maxwell's total recorded assets were approximately $14.7 million, with about $6 million already transferred to UBS.

The financial transfer involved multiple entities controlled by or associated with Maxwell, including the Max Foundation, 116 East 65th Street ILLC, Pot and Kettle LLC, El!max LLC, TerraMar Project, Inc., and Max Hotel Services Corp.
The TerraMar Project, Inc., a non-profit organization publicly associated with Maxwell, held assets totaling $50,989.28 as of the end of 2013.
The document indicates a systematic movement of Maxwell's personal and business assets from JPMorgan Chase (JPM) to UBS bank in early 2014.
